result.execSummary:
The defendant William G Stephens Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay by the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.

- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- No Contact with victims.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William G Stephens Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Bond Refund Packet
2/5/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety/defendant.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Itzel S.-C.

As to Count 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   No contact with victims.
     *   Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the
          DNA surcharge.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.
          Failure to pay by the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of
          an entry of a civil judgment.

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights, received and filed

Defendant William G Stephens in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Count 1:
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined by the court as to the plea. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
Motion in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant William G Stephens in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Jury Trial set for 02-03-2016 at 08:30 am. in Branch 4.   All parties are advised effective February 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant William G Stephens in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William G Stephens in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be reassigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45 in Room 515 of the Courthouse. Case set for adjourned pretrial conference at request of defense.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William G Stephens in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DUPLICATE FILE. Case set for Pretrial Conference, defense counsel requested an adjournment of the Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Letter received from attorney Scholz regarding scheduling error.  Case scheduled for pretrial conference on 8-06-2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 23.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Judge, Br.45.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 08-03-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for William G Stephens Jr
Current: 1730 South 22nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 06-29-2015)
Prior: 1730 South 22nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Edgar C.-G., Elizabeth Q., Itzel S.-C. and Gabriel R. or their residence or place of employment

Defendant William G Stephens in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 45. As of 8/3/15, this case will be reassigned to Judge Grady, branch 23.vb
